Docs.summary: Events interface for Microsoft Word object events.

Docs.summary: Occurs when you insert a building block into a document.

remarks.para: For information about using events with the object, see Using Events with the Document Object

Docs.summary: Occurs when a document is closed.

remarks.para: If the event procedure is stored in a template, the procedure will run when a new document based on that template is closed and when the template itself is closed (after being opened as a document).

Docs.summary: Occurs after adding a content control to a document.

remarks.para: For information about using events with the object, see Using Events with the Document Object

Docs.summary: Occurs before updating the content in a content control, only when the content comes from the Office XML data store.

remarks.para: For information about using events with the object, see Using Events with the Document Object

Docs.summary: Occurs before removing a content control from a document.

remarks.para: For information about using events with the object, see Using Events with the Document Object

Docs.summary: Occurs before updating the document's XML data store with the value of a content control.

remarks.para: For information about using events with the object, see Using Events with the Document Object

Docs.summary: Occurs when a user enters a content control.

remarks.para: Important: This event fires only for the content control that you enter and not for parent content controls. For example, if you have a text box content control nested inside a group content control, and you place the cursor inside the text box content control, this event fires only once for the text box content control; it does not fire for the parent group content control.
For information about using events with the object, see Using Events with the Document Object

Docs.summary: Occurs when a user leaves a content control.

remarks.para: Important: This event fires only for the content control that you exit and not for parent content controls. For example, if you have a text box content control nested inside a group content control, and you move the cursor from inside the text box content control and into another place in the document, this event fires only once for the text box content control; it does not fire for the parent group content control.
For information about using events with the object, see Using Events with the Document Object

Docs.summary: Occurs when a new document based on the template is created.

remarks.para: A procedure for the New event will run only if it is stored in a template.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a document is opened.

remarks.para: If the event procedure is stored in a template, the procedure will run when a new document based on that template is opened and when the template itself is opened as a document.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the local copy of a document that is part of a Document Workspace is synchronized with the copy on the server.
Occurs when a user adds a new XML element to a document.

remarks.para: If more than one element is added to the document at the same time (for example, when cutting and pasting XML), the event fires for each element that is inserted.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a user deletes an XML element from a document.

remarks.para: If more than one element is deleted from the document at the same time (for example, when cutting and pasting XML), the event fires for each element that is deleted.
